name: Class TreeUI
text: Pluggable look and feel interface for JTree.
codes:
public abstract class TreeUI
extends ComponentUI

methods.method_sig:
public abstract Rectangle getPathBounds (JTree tree,
                                        TreePath path)
methods.description:
Returns the Rectangle enclosing the label portion that the
 last item in path will be drawn into.  Will return null if
 any component in path is currently valid.

methods.method_sig:
public abstract TreePath getPathForRow (JTree tree,
                                       int row)
methods.description:
Returns the path for passed in row.  If row is not visible
 null is returned.

methods.method_sig:
public abstract int getRowForPath (JTree tree,
                                  TreePath path)
methods.description:
Returns the row that the last item identified in path is visible
 at.  Will return -1 if any of the elements in path are not
 currently visible.
Returns the number of rows that are being displayed.

Returns the path to the node that is closest to x,y.  If
 there is nothing currently visible this will return null, otherwise
 it'll always return a valid path.  If you need to test if the
 returned object is exactly at x, y you should get the bounds for
 the returned path and test x, y against that.

Returns true if the tree is being edited.  The item that is being
 edited can be returned by getEditingPath().

Stops the current editing session.  This has no effect if the
 tree isn't being edited.  Returns true if the editor allows the
 editing session to stop.

Cancels the current editing session. This has no effect if the
 tree isn't being edited.

methods.method_sig:
public abstract void startEditingAtPath (JTree tree,
                                        TreePath path)
methods.description:
Selects the last item in path and tries to edit it.  Editing will
 fail if the CellEditor won't allow it for the selected item.
Returns the path to the element that is being edited.
